pers.columbus.name: Christopher Columbus
pers.columbus.note: Italian explorer who completed four voyages across the Atlantic Ocean, opening the way for widespread European exploration and colonization of the Americas.

pers.humboldt.name: Alexander von Humboldt
pers.humboldt.note: Prussian polymath, geographer, naturalist, and explorer who made significant contributions to the fields of geography and natural sciences.

pers.bonpland.name: Aimé Bonpland
pers.bonpland.note: French botanist and explorer known for his collaboration with Humboldt during their expedition to the Americas.

pers.aublet.name: Jean Baptiste Christophore Fusée Aublet
pers.aublet.note: French botanist notable for his work in French Guiana and his publication 'Histoire des Plantes de la Guiane Françoise'.

pers.boussingault.name: Jean-Baptiste Boussingault
pers.boussingault.note: French chemist who made significant contributions to agricultural chemistry and studied the nutrition of plants.

pers.langsdorff.name: Georg Heinrich von Langsdorff
pers.langsdorff.note: German naturalist and explorer who led expeditions in Brazil and contributed to the study of South American flora and fauna.

pers.schomburgk.name: Robert Hermann Schomburgk
pers.schomburgk.note: German-born British explorer who conducted geographical and botanical studies in Guyana and mapped the boundaries of British Guiana.

pers.stevenson.name: William B. Stevenson
pers.stevenson.note: An explorer known for his travels in South America during the early 19th century.

pers.poeppig.name: Eduard Friedrich Poeppig
pers.poeppig.note: German botanist and zoologist who explored South America and contributed to the knowledge of its natural history.

pers.weddell.name: Hugh Algernon Weddell
pers.weddell.note: British-French botanist known for his studies of South American flora, particularly in the Andes.

pers.dobrizhoffer.name: Martin Dobrizhoffer
pers.dobrizhoffer.note: Austrian Jesuit missionary who worked among the indigenous peoples of South America and wrote about their cultures.

pers.castelnau.name: Francis de Laporte de Castelnau
pers.castelnau.note: French naturalist known for his explorations in South America and contributions to entomology.

pers.tschudi.name: Johann Jakob von Tschudi
pers.tschudi.note: Swiss naturalist and explorer who conducted extensive research in Peru and other parts of South America.

pers.cuvier.name: Georges Cuvier
pers.cuvier.note: French naturalist and zoologist, a major figure in natural sciences, known for establishing extinction as a fact.

pers.linnaeus.name: Carl Linnaeus
pers.linnaeus.note: Swedish botanist who formalized binomial nomenclature, the modern system of naming organisms.

pers.darwin.name: Charles Darwin
pers.darwin.note: English naturalist who developed the theory of evolution by natural selection.

pers.wallace.name: Alfred Russel Wallace
pers.wallace.occupation: Naturalist, Explorer, Geographer, Anthropologist, and Biologist
pers.wallace.note: British naturalist known for independently conceiving the theory of evolution through natural selection.

pers.martius.name: Carl Friedrich Philipp von Martius
pers.martius.note: German botanist and explorer who studied Brazilian flora.

pers.spruce.name: Richard Spruce
pers.spruce.note: English botanist known for his exploration of the Amazon and his studies of bryophytes.

pers.bates.name: Henry Walter Bates
pers.bates.note: English naturalist who explored the Amazon and developed the concept of Batesian mimicry.
